messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

Imagine a flower county with 15 flower fields. The rose field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and carnation field. The sunflower field is connected to the orchid field, peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The tulip field is connected to the hydrangea field, daffodil field, marigold field, and peony field. The daisy field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and lavender field. The orchid field is connected to the peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The hydrangea field is connected to the daffodil field, marigold field, and lavender field. The lily field is connected to the chrysanthemum field, and poppy field. The peony field is connected to the zinnia field. The daffodil field is connected to the marigold field and lavender field. The chrysanthemum field is connected to poppy field. The carnation field is connected to the zinnia field. The marigold field is connected to the lavender field. You have been told that you can get a bunch of 50 peony flowers for free if you visit peony field and you can get a bunch of 10 lavender flowers for free if you choose to visit lavender field. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

(Do this only if you can provide a correct answer.)
user: the correct answer is daisy (the shortest path is daisy->hydrangea->daffodil), marigold->lavender
\daisy marigold lavender
user: Answer: (\daisy , \s*)+*
There are several reasons the regex does not work. You cannot assume that there can be only one solution as there could be multiple valid combinations that could result in a solution. You cannot guarantee that the user would have all of the required flower fields available as they may be locked and may not have the required fields available.
user: Imagine a flower county with 15 flower fields. The rose field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and carnation field. The sunflower field is connected to the orchid field, peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The tulip field is connected to the hydrangea field, daffodil field, marigold field, and poppy field. The daisy field is connected to the lily field, chrysanthemum field, poppy field, and lavender field. The orchid field is connected to the peony field, carnation field, and zinnia field. The hydrangea field is connected to the daffodil field, marigold field, and lavender field. The lily field is connected to the chrysanthemum field and poppy field. The peony field is connected to the zinnia field. The daffodil field is connected to the marigold field and lavender field. The chrysanthemum field is connected to poppy field. The carnation field is connected to the zinnia field. The marigold field is connected to the lavender field. You have been told that you can get a bunch of 10 peony flowers for free if you visit peony field and you can get a bunch of 50 roses for free if you choose to visit rose field. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas. (Do this only if

Now you have been told that the rose field is no longer connected to the carnation field and instead, now the rose field is connected to the marigold field. Also, the daisy field is no longer connected to the lavender field and instead, now the daisy field is connected to the carnation field. Now, from the rose field what is the shortest path that yields the maximum number of flowers? Remember that you can only take one bunch of flowers and only from one field. Starting from the rose field, please list the flower names in order, including rose, separated by commas.

(Do this only if you can provide a correct answer.)
The maximum number of flowers are obtained when you go from Rose to Daisy, then to Lavender, then to Marigold and finally to Carnation. Note that Carnation field doesn't exist in 2nd scenario so it cannot be visited.

Note that this does not match the desired result (which is 58), the correct answer is 50 as that is the max amount of flowers available.
